text: 16.04.14 - Rules Governing the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program
label: BODY

text: 005. Office -- Office Hours -- Mailing Address -- Street Address -- Telephone -- Internet
label: BODY

text: 006. Confidentiality Of Records And Public Records Requests.  .............................. 3
label: BODY

text: 202. Application Time Limits And Disposal Actions.  ................................................. 8
label: BODY

text: 16.04.14 - RULES GOVERNING THE LOW INCOME HOME ENERGY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM
label: BODY

text: This program is authorized by the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981, 42 U.S.C Sections 8621 to
label: BODY

text: 8629, and by provisions of Section 56-202 Idaho Code.
label: BODY

text: Title. These rules are to be cited as IDAPA 16.04.14, “Rules Governing the Low Income Home
label: BODY

text: Energy Assistance Program,” and may also be known as LIHEAP.
label: BODY

text: Scope. The intent of the program is to provide assistance to eligible low income households
label: BODY

text: particularly those with the lowest incomes, that pay the highest proportion of their income for home energy, primarily
label: BODY

text: in meeting their immediate home energy needs.
label: BODY

text: Program Limitation. This federally funded program does not entitle any household to a certain
label: BODY

text: amount or form of assistance. An eligible participant household will receive one (1) benefit payment from the
label: BODY

text: standard program funding each program year.
label: BODY

text: In accordance with Section 67-5201(19)(b)(iv), Idaho Code, this agency may have written statements that pertain to
label: BODY

text: the interpretations of the rules of this chapter. These documents are available for public inspection as described in
label: BODY

text: Appeals and proceedings are governed by IDAPA 16.05.03, “Rules Governing Contested Case Proceedings and
label: BODY

text: The following document is incorporated by reference in this chapter of rule: Low Income Home Energy Assistance
label: BODY

text: www.healthandwelfare.idaho.gov/. The manual is also available at the mailing address listed in Section 005 of this
label: BODY

text: rule, and at Community Action Agencies.
label: BODY

text: OFFICE -- OFFICE HOURS -- MAILING ADDRESS -- STREET ADDRESS -- TELEPHONE --
label: BODY

text: Office Hours. Office hours are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Mountain Time, Monday through Friday, except
label: BODY

text: holidays designated by the state of Idaho.
label: BODY

text: Mailing Address. The mailing address for the business office is Idaho Department of Health and
label: BODY

text: Street Address. The business office of the Idaho Department of Health and Welfare is located at
label: BODY

text: Internet Website. Department Internet website is http://www.healthandwelfare.idaho.gov/.
label: BODY

text: CONFIDENTIALITY OF RECORDS AND PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS.
label: BODY

text: Confidential Records. Any information about an individual covered by these rules and contained
label: BODY

text: in Department records must comply with IDAPA 16.05.01, “Use and Disclosure of Department Records.” (3-30-07)
label: BODY

text: Public Records. The Department of Health and Welfare will comply with Sections 9-337 through
label: BODY

text: 9-350, Idaho Code, when requests for the examination and copying of public records are made. Public records in the
label: BODY

text: custody of the Department of Health and Welfare are subject to disclosure, unless otherwise exempted by state or
label: BODY

text: In addition to any actions specified in these rules, the Department may audit, investigate, and take enforcement action
label: BODY

text: under the provisions of IDAPA 16.05.07, “Investigation and Enforcement of Fraud, Abuse, and Misconduct.”
label: BODY

text: Definitions applicable to this chapter of rules.
label: BODY

text: Community Action Agency. A private non-profit organization serving the low income population
label: BODY

text: in specified counties of the state with which the Department has entered into a contract for the provision of services
label: BODY

text: Crisis Assistance. Energy assistance provided to an eligible participant household to reduce or
label: BODY

text: eliminate an energy related health threatening situation to the household.
label: BODY

text: Department. The Department of Health and Welfare or its designee.
label: BODY

text: Federal Poverty Guidelines (FPG). The federal poverty guidelines issued annually by the U. S.
label: BODY

text: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). The federal poverty guidelines are available on the U.S. Health
label: BODY

text: and Human Services website at: http://aspe.hhs.gov/poverty/.
label: BODY

text: Fraud. Recipient fraud is indicated where there appears to be a deliberate attempt to conceal or
label: BODY

text: misrepresent pertinent information which could affect eligibility or grant amounts.
label: BODY

text: Head of Participant Household. The person designated by the household members to receive
label: BODY

text: energy assistance benefit in behalf of the household and in whose favor the energy assistance warrant is written.
label: BODY

text: Income. Income is the gross amount of moneys actually received in the participant household from
label: BODY

text: Intake Manual. Manual used by community action agencies for procedural policy and benefit
label: BODY

text: calculation factors, which is published annually by the Department.
label: BODY

text: Participant. An individual or group of individuals who has made application for the Low Income
label: BODY

text: Home Energy Assistance Program from the state of Idaho.
label: BODY

text: Participant Household. A participant household is one (1) of the following:
label: BODY

text: An individual who lives alone; or
label: BODY

text: A group of individuals who are living together as one (1) economic unit where residential energy is
label: BODY

text: customarily purchased in common or they make undesignated payments for energy in the form of rent.
label: BODY

text: Primary Fuel. The type of fuel declared by the participant household to be the major source of
label: BODY

text: Undocumented Resident. Individuals who enter the United States illegally and who have not
label: BODY

text: Vendor. A utility company or other provider of fuel utilized for home heating.
label: BODY

text: The participant case record is the documentary basis justifying the expenditure of LIHEAP funds. All material
label: BODY

text: pertinent to a participant household will be retained for a permanent record. Each decision justifying a participant
label: BODY

text: household is eligible or ineligible for LIHEAP benefits, must be supported by information in the permanent record
label: BODY

text: showing that each eligibility requirement is met or that one (1) or more eligibility requirements are not met. (7-1-99)
label: BODY

text: Funds made available through the LIHEAP grant will be used as follows:
label: BODY

text: Home Utility and Bulk Fuel Costs. These costs include those incurred by the eligible participant
label: BODY

text: household for electricity, natural gas and bulk fuel for home energy needs, but does not include costs incurred for
label: BODY

text: Governor Declared Emergency or Disaster. A portion of the LIHEAP grant funds may be used
label: BODY

text: for home heating supply shortages experienced by the participant household or a weather-related emergency which
label: BODY

text: threatens the health or lives of an area’s inhabitants such that the Governor declares a state of emergency.
label: BODY

text: Catastrophic Illness Costs. Households with income exceeding eligibility guidelines may be
label: BODY

text: eligible due to catastrophic illness. The household’s unreimbursed medical expenses from the previous twelve (12)
label: BODY

text: months are subtracted from the household’s gross income for the same period. If the household then meets income
label: BODY

text: guidelines, the Department makes a final eligibility determination.
label: BODY

text: Low-Cost Residential Weatherization. Funds reserved for weatherization services to low-income
label: BODY

text: households pursuant to Department of Energy, Weatherization Assistance Program Regulations, when in accordance
label: BODY

text: The participant has rights protected by federal and state laws and Department rules. The Department or their designee
label: BODY

text: must inform the participant of their rights during the application process and eligibility determination, as follows:
label: BODY

text: Right to Apply. Any participant household wishing to apply must be given the opportunity,
label: BODY

text: without delay, to apply for LIHEAP benefits. All participants must apply in writing.
label: BODY

text: Right to a Hearing. Rules governing hearing rights are contained in Idaho Department of Health
label: BODY

text: and Welfare Rules, IDAPA 16.05.03, “Rules Governing Contested Case Proceedings and Declaratory Rulings.”
label: BODY

text: Civil Rights. The rights of participant households must be respected under the U.S. and Idaho
label: BODY

text: Constitutions, the Social Security Act, Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and all
label: BODY

text: other relevant provisions of federal and state law, including the avoidance of practices which violate a person’s
label: BODY

text: Each participant applying for LIHEAP benefits must, to the extent permitted by their physical and mental condition,
label: BODY

text: provide all necessary and reasonable verification to establish eligibility, and must otherwise cooperate in the
label: BODY

text: LIHEAP benefits paid to eligible participant households must not be counted as income or resources for any purpose
label: BODY

text: under any federal or state law, including any law relating to taxation, public assistance, or welfare programs.(7-1-99)
label: BODY

text: A participant household will apply on Department prescribed forms and designate a head of household.
label: BODY

text: All participant households assisted through LIHEAP must provide proof of both financial eligibility requirements and
label: BODY

text: Failing to Meet the Financial and Non-Financial Eligibility. Participant households failing to
label: BODY

text: meet the financial and non-financial eligibility requirements will be denied LIHEAP assistance.
label: BODY

text: Participant’s Signature. A participant’s signature on the application is their consent for the
label: BODY

text: Department to contact collateral sources for verification of the eligibility requirement(s).
label: BODY

text: Under 42 U.S.C. 8624(b)(2)(B)(ii), assistance under this program is limited to participant households with countable
label: BODY

text: income at or below one hundred fifty percent (150%) of the Federal Poverty Guideline. Participant households must
label: BODY

text: provide proof of income for all members during the application process.
label: BODY

text: Households Receiving SSI or Food Stamps. Households in which one (1) or more individuals are
label: BODY

text: receiving one (1) of the following are eligible for LIHEAP:
label: BODY

text: Supplemental Security Income (SSI) under Title XVI of the Social Security Act; or
label: BODY

text: Food Stamps under the Food Stamp Act of 1977, under 7 USC 2011 through 2027.
label: BODY

text: Income Not Counted. Income listed in Subsections 151.02.a. through 151.02.t. is not counted in
label: BODY

text: determining LIHEAP eligibility or benefit level. All other income is counted in determining LIHEAP eligibility and
label: BODY

text: Private loans made to the participant or the household.
label: BODY

text: Assets withdrawn from a personal bank account.
label: BODY

text: Sale of real property, if the funds are reinvested within three (3) calendar months.
label: BODY

text: Infrequent, irregular or unpredictable income from gifts or lottery winnings of less than thirty
label: BODY

text: dollars ($30) during the three (3) month period before application for LIHEAP.
label: BODY

text: Wages or allowances for attendant care when the attendant resides in the household of the disabled
label: BODY

text: Interest income of thirty dollars ($30) or less received during the three (3) month period before
label: BODY

text: Legal fees or settlements from Workman’s Compensation paid in a lump sum.
label: BODY

text: Monies received for educational purposes from NSDL, College work-study programs, State
label: BODY

text: Student Incentive grants, SEOG, Pell, Guaranteed Student Loans and Supplemental grants funded under Title IV, A-2.
label: BODY

text: Monies from VA-GI Bill for Education.
label: BODY

text: Department of Health and Welfare Adoption subsidies.
label: BODY

text: Compensation provided volunteers in the Older American Act or Foster Grandparent Program,
label: BODY

text: including Green Thumb and Vista volunteers, Title V Senior Employment Program.
label: BODY

text: Third party payments made by a non-household member on behalf of the household. Third party
label: BODY

text: payments include child care, energy assistance funds, shelter, food and clothing assistance.
label: BODY

text: Value of food stamps or donated food to household.
label: BODY

text: Income Received Monthly. To determine LIHEAP eligibility and benefit amount, when
label: BODY

text: participant household income is received at least monthly, use the three (3) month’s income prior to the date of
label: BODY

text: Income Received Less Often Than Monthly. For household income received less often than
label: BODY

text: monthly convert the income into a three (3) month amount:
label: BODY

text: Multiply income received weekly by twelve and nine tenths (12.9).
label: BODY

text: Multiply income received every two (2) weeks by six and forty-five hundredths (6.45).
label: BODY

text: Multiply income received twice each month by six (6).
label: BODY

text: Seasonal and Self-Employment Income. For households with seasonal or self-employment
label: BODY

text: income divide the annual income by four (4).
label: BODY

text: Treatment of Undocumented Resident Income. If a household includes eligible and ineligible
label: BODY

text: undocumented resident participants, and one (1) or more of the ineligible participants had income during the
label: BODY

text: reporting period, count the ineligible participants’ income and exclude the undocumented resident from the
label: BODY

text: For the purpose of assistance under LIHEAP, the participant household must meet the following non-financial
label: BODY

text: Residence. At the time the application is completed, the participant must reside in the state of
label: BODY

text: Idaho. LIHEAP benefits are not transferable to an out-of-state residence.
label: BODY

text: Living Situations. The participant household must reside in housing where they are responsible for
label: BODY

text: home energy costs and incur the costs either directly or as an undesignated portion of their rent. Living situations
label: BODY

text: where residents are not responsible for energy costs include hospitals, nursing homes, shelter homes, commercial
label: BODY

text: Native Americans. Native American households whose tribe has entered into a separate agreement
label: BODY

text: with the federal funding agency and the Department to receive LIHEAP grant funds, are not entitled to benefits under
label: BODY

text: Funds are depleted and an emergency exists.
label: BODY

text: Resident Status. At least one (1) household member must be a citizen or legal resident of the
label: BODY

text: United States. As part of the application process, participants must sign a declaration, under penalty of perjury,
label: BODY

text: attesting to the residency or citizenship status of all household members.
label: BODY

text: Low-income participants may complete an application for LIHEAP benefits at a CAA. The CAA will submit the
label: BODY

text: participant household information contained on the application to the Department on-line computer system for
label: BODY

text: A participant must be provided a prompt opportunity to complete an application for assistance. Application forms
label: BODY

text: must contain a statement which clearly explains participant’s civil and criminal liability for the truthfulness of the
label: BODY

text: information included on the forms; and their right to a hearing according to Idaho Department of Health and Welfare
label: BODY

text: Rules, IDAPA 16.05.03, “Rules Governing Contested Cases Proceedings and Declaratory Rulings.”
label: BODY

text: Date of Application. The participant application process begins the date the completed and signed
label: BODY

text: application and all supporting forms are received by the CAA.
label: BODY

text: Participant Representation. A participant household may be assisted by a person or persons of
label: BODY

text: their choice and, when accompanied by such persons, may be represented by them.
label: BODY

text: Signature. The application must be signed by the participant designated at the head of household,
label: BODY

text: Applications signed by a designee must have a letter of authorization or power of attorney from the
label: BODY

text: Employees of the CAA or the Department must not be designated to sign the application. (7-1-99)
label: BODY

text: Signature by Mark. A signature by mark requires two (2) witnesses. The signatures and addresses
label: BODY

text: of the witnesses must appear on the application, followed by the word “witness.”
label: BODY

text: Assistance with Application. When completing the application forms or obtaining required
label: BODY

text: documentation, each participant must be provided assistance from the CAA, including the provision for interpreters
label: BODY

text: for participant households with limited or non-English speaking skills.
label: BODY

text: APPLICATION TIME LIMITS AND DISPOSAL ACTIONS.
label: BODY

text: Unless circumstances beyond the control of the Department prohibit it, each application is to be acted upon within
label: BODY

text: thirty (30) days from the date the application is completed and signed by the participant. An application for LIHEAP
label: BODY

text: assistance must be disposed of by one (1) of the following three (3) methods:
label: BODY

text: Approval. A determination the participant household is eligible for LIHEAP benefits.
label: BODY

text: Denial. A determination the participant household is ineligible for LIHEAP benefits or that
label: BODY

text: eligibility could not be determined due to lack of necessary information or verification.
label: BODY

text: Withdrawal. The participant household voluntarily requests that no further consideration be given
label: BODY

text: to their application or the participant becomes deceased.
label: BODY

text: Each participant household must be notified, in writing, of the decision made with regard to their LIHEAP
label: BODY

text: Approvals. At the time the application is completed, the participant household will receive a copy
label: BODY

text: of their preliminary approval notification. The Department issuance of the benefit payment or denial notice will be
label: BODY

text: the participant household’s formal eligibility notification.
label: BODY

text: Denials or Withdrawals. The LIHEAP Notice of Denial will be provided to participant
label: BODY

text: households denied assistance and include the reason for the denial and an explanation of the participant household’s
label: BODY

text: right to appeal the eligibility decision.
label: BODY

text: Eligible participant households will have their LIHEAP benefit determined as follows:
label: BODY

text: Actual Consumption Method. The actual consumption method is used if the eligible participant
label: BODY

text: household heats its residence with either natural gas or electricity and has resided in the residence for one (1) year or
label: BODY

text: longer. Household benefit is calculated by multiplying the energy consumption cost by an annual benefit calculation
label: BODY

text: factor. Annual minimum and maximum benefits per household are published each year in the Intake Manual used for
label: BODY

text: Average Annual Cost Method. The average annual cost method is used when the eligible
label: BODY

text: participant household’s actual consumption cost is unknown, or it uses a heating source other than electricity or
label: BODY

text: natural gas. Average cost is determined by information provided by energy suppliers throughout the state and is
label: BODY

text: published as the Annual Heating Cost Chart which is available from the Department of Health and Welfare. The
label: BODY

text: average cost is specific to county of residence and the household’s heating source. Household benefit is calculated by
label: BODY

text: multiplying the Average Annual Cost by an annual benefit calculation factor.
label: BODY

text: Annual Benefit Calculation Factor. Annual benefit calculation factors are determined each year
label: BODY

text: based on the amount of federal funding for the upcoming program year. The particular factor used for a household’s
label: BODY

text: benefit calculation is determined by the household’s energy cost burden (high, medium or low) expressed as a
label: BODY

text: percentage of annualized income. A heating burden of zero percent (0%) to five percent (5%) is low, six percent (6%)
label: BODY

text: to ten percent (10%) is medium, and eleven percent (11%) or greater is high. Benefit calculation methodology and the
label: BODY

text: current benefit calculation factors are published in the Intake Manual used for LIHEAP, available at the Department
label: BODY

text: or on its website, and at community action agencies.
label: BODY

text: Adjusting LIHEAP Benefit. Households containing at least one (1) of the following may be
label: BODY

text: eligible for an adjusted benefit. The adjusted benefit amounts and eligibility levels will be published annually in the
label: BODY

text: Intake Manual used for LIHEAP, available at the Department or on its website, and at community action agencies.
label: BODY

text: Child under six (6) years of age.
label: BODY

text: Individual with disabilities as declared on the LIHEAP application form.
label: BODY

text: Individual sixty (60) years of age or older.
label: BODY

text: There are three (3) methods for paying LIHEAP benefits to eligible participant households. Each payment is based on
label: BODY

text: the source of the home energy and whether the energy cost is paid by the participant directly or indirectly.
label: BODY

text: When an eligible participant household receives a LIHEAP benefit payment directly, they must endorse it and take it
label: BODY

text: to their designated energy supplier. Two-party payments will have the name of the energy supplier imprinted on the
label: BODY

text: face of the warrant. When an eligible participant and their energy supplier endorse the LIHEAP benefit payment, they
label: BODY

text: certify that to the best of their knowledge, the funds are being used to provide home energy for the eligible participant
label: BODY

text: All participating energy suppliers must enter into a vendor agreement with the Department to provide home energy
label: BODY

text: Payments issued on behalf of a participant household that is not eligible must be repaid to the Department. (3-29-12)
label: BODY

text: Recoupment of Overpayment. The Department may recoup or recover the amount issued on
label: BODY

text: behalf of a LIHEAP participant. Interest will accrue on overpayments at the statutory rate set under Section 28-22-
label: BODY

text: 104, Idaho Code, from the date of the final determination of the amount owed for services. Recoupment of an
label: BODY

text: overpayment based on Department error may be collected from a vendor or participant when the overpayment is one
label: BODY

text: hundred dollars ($100), or more. Interest will not accrue on overpayments made due to Department error. An
label: BODY

text: overpayment due to vendor or participant error, intentional program violations (IPV), or fraud must be recovered in
label: BODY

text: Repayment Requirement. A vendor or participant must repay any overpayment, but may
label: BODY

text: negotiate a repayment schedule with the Department. Failure to comply with the negotiated repayment agreement
label: BODY

text: will result in revocation of that agreement and may result in the revocation of the vendor agreement.
label: BODY

text: An IPV is an intentionally false or misleading action or statement as identified below in Subsections 310.01 through
label: BODY

text: 310.07 of this rule. An IPV is established when a vendor or participant admits the IPV in writing and waives the right
label: BODY

text: to an administrative hearing, or when determined by an administrative hearing, a court decision, or through deferred
label: BODY

text: adjudication. Deferred adjudication exists when the court defers a determination of guilt because the accused vendor
label: BODY

text: or participant meets the terms of a court order or an agreement with the prosecutor.
label: BODY

text: False Statement. An individual or vendor makes a false statement to the Department, either orally
label: BODY

text: or in writing, in order to participate in LIHEAP.
label: BODY

text: Misleading Statement. An individual or vendor makes a misleading statement to the Department,
label: BODY

text: either orally or in writing, to participate in LIHEAP.
label: BODY

text: Misrepresentation of Fact. An individual or vendor misrepresents one (1) or more facts to the
label: BODY

text: Department, either orally or in writing, to participate in LIHEAP.
label: BODY

text: Concealing Fact. An individual or vendor conceals or withholds one (1) or more facts to
label: BODY

text: Non-Compliance With Rules and Regulations. An individual or vendor fails repeatedly or
label: BODY

text: substantially to comply with this chapter of rules.
label: BODY

text: Violation of Vendor Agreement. A vendor or any agent thereof who knowingly violates any term
label: BODY

text: Failure to Repay. An individual or vendor has failed to repay, or was a managing employee or had
label: BODY

text: an ownership or control interest in any entity that has failed to repay, any overpayments or claims previously found to
label: BODY

text: have been obtained contrary to statute, rule, regulation, or vendor agreement.
label: BODY

text: When the Department determines an IPV was committed, the participant or vendor who committed the IPV loses
label: BODY

text: eligibility to participate in LIHEAP. If an individual in a LIHEAP household has committed an IPV, the entire
label: BODY

text: household is ineligible for LIHEAP. If a vendor has committed an IPV, the vendor is ineligible to receive payments.
label: BODY

text: The period of ineligibility for each offense, for both a participant or a vendor, is as follows:
label: BODY

text: First Offense. Twelve (12) months, for the first IPV or fraud offense, or the length of time
label: BODY

text: Second Offense. Twenty-four (24) months for the second IPV or fraud offense, or the length of
label: BODY

text: Third Offense. Permanent ineligibility for the third or subsequent IPV or fraud offense, or the
label: BODY

text: length of time specified by the court.
label: BODY

text: The Department may deny payment to the vendor or participant for the reasons described in Subsections 320.01
label: BODY

text: Services Not Provided. Any or all claims for vendor services the Department determines were not
label: BODY

text: Contrary to Rules or Provider Agreement. Vendor services provided contrary to these rules or
label: BODY

text: Failure to Provide Immediate Access to Records. The vendor does not allow immediate access
label: BODY

text: by the Department to LIHEAP records.
label: BODY

text: Willful Misrepresentation or Concealment of Facts. The vendor or participant willfully
label: BODY

text: misrepresents or conceals facts relating to LIHEAP.
label: BODY

text: Under Section 56-209h, Idaho Code, the Department may terminate the vendor agreement of, or otherwise deny
label: BODY

text: vendor status for a period up to five (5) years from the date the Department's action becomes final to any individual or
label: BODY

text: Submits an Incorrect Claim. Submits a claim with knowledge that the claim is incorrect.
label: BODY

text: Fraudulent Claim. Submits a fraudulent claim.
label: BODY

text: Knowingly Makes a False Statement. Knowingly makes a false statement or representation of
label: BODY

text: material facts in any document required to be maintained or submitted to the Department.
label: BODY

text: Immediate Access to Documentation. Fails to provide, upon written request by the Department,
label: BODY

text: immediate access to documentation required to be maintained.
label: BODY

text: Non-Compliance With Rules and Regulations. Fails repeatedly or substantially to comply with
label: BODY

text: the rules and regulations governing LIHEAP payments.
label: BODY

text: Violation of Material Term or Condition. Knowingly violates any material term or condition of
label: BODY

text: Failure to Repay. Has failed to repay, or was a managing employee or had an ownership or control
label: BODY

text: interest in any entity that has failed to repay, any overpayments or claims previously found to have been obtained
label: BODY

text: contrary to statute, rule, regulation, or vendor agreement.
label: BODY

text: Fraudulent or Abusive Conduct. Has been found, or was a managing employee in any entity
label: BODY

text: which has been found, to have engaged in fraudulent conduct or abusive conduct in connection with the delivery of
label: BODY

text: REFUSAL TO ENTER INTO AN AGREEMENT.
label: BODY

text: The Department may refuse to enter into a vendor agreement for the reasons described in Subsections 351.01 through
label: BODY

text: Convicted of a Felony. The vendor has been convicted of a felony relating to their involvement in
label: BODY

text: Failed to Repay. The vendor has failed to repay the Department monies which had been previously
label: BODY

text: determined to have been owed to the Department.
label: BODY

text: Investigation Pending. The vendor has a pending investigation for program fraud or abuse.
label: BODY

text: Terminated Vendor Agreement. The vendor was the managing employee, officer, or owner of an
label: BODY

text: entity whose vendor agreement was terminated under Section 350 of these rules.
label: BODY

text: Excluded Individuals. The vendor has a current exclusion from participation in federal programs
label: BODY

text: by the Office of Inspector General List of Excluded Individuals and Entities.
label: BODY

text: When the Department determines any actions defined in Sections 303 through 351 of these rules are appropriate, it
label: BODY

text: will send written notice of the decision to the vendor or participant. The notice will state the basis for the action, the
label: BODY

text: length of the action, the effect of the action on the participant or the vendor’s ability to provide services under state
label: BODY

text: and federal programs, and appeal rights.
label: BODY

text: The provisions in Sections 000 through 999 inclusive, are contingent upon availability and receipt of funds
label: BODY

text: appropriated through federal legislation. When federal funds are not available to the state of Idaho, these provisions
label: BODY

text: or any part therein shall be considered dormant and there may be no advance notice of termination or reduction of
label: BODY

text: benefits may be disposed. In the event that additional funds are available a supplemental payment can be made, in an
label: BODY

text: equitable manner, to each eligible household at the discretion of the Director.
label: BODY

text: Failing to Meet The Financial & Non-
label: BODY
